articles.title: Mystery of the “Red Monsters”: Webb Finds Massive Early Galaxies That Shouldn’t Exist - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Researchers using the James Webb Space Telescope have discovered three massive galaxies from the early universe, revealing them to be as massive as the Milky Way and forming stars with surprising efficiency. This finding, which contradicts earlier models of s…
articles.content: The three red monsters are extremely massive and dusty galaxies in the first billion years after the Big Bang. Credit: NASA/CSA/ESA, M. Xiao & P. A. Oesch (University of Geneva), G. Brammer (Niel… [+5876 chars]

articles.author: Andrew Cunningham
articles.title: Review: Amazon’s 2024 Kindle Paperwhite makes the best e-reader a little better - Ars Technica
articles.description: If you use any Kindle other than the 2021 Paperwhite, this is a huge upgrade.
